page.title: 06Codsall Parish Church
page.content: There has been a church on the hill for many centuries. The oldest part of St. Nicholas' is the tower which dates back to the 11th.century. The tower has 52 steps and 8 bells. There are thirteen stained glass windows one of which has a picture of the church itself. The porch is on the south side. The church is on the highest ground locally, being 450 feet above sea level and local tradition has it that there is no higher land between the church and Russia ! The original vicarage was built in l848 (the same year that the Birmingham - Shrewsbury Railway reached Codsall) on the site of a former public house called the Bush. During the previous year Codsall had become a separate Parish.
